body_html:
@carpodaster I still think that Google does export deterministically, with , as a separator (csv stands for 'comma-separated values' after all) and " wrapping of values which contain commas.

@F3PiX Could you please clarify how you see it? Do you mean that Google Sheets exports differently depending on some circumstances?
body_text:
@carpodaster I still think that Google does export deterministically, with , as a separator (csv stands for 'comma-separated values' after all) and " wrapping of values which contain commas.
@F3PiX Could you please clarify how you see it? Do you mean that Google Sheets exports differently depending on some circumstances?
body:
@carpodaster I still think that Google does export deterministically, with `,` as a separator (csv stands for 'comma-separated values' after all) and `"` wrapping of values which contain commas.

@F3PiX Could you please clarify how you see it? Do you mean that Google Sheets exports differently depending on some circumstances?
